meanings.definition: In a way that can be transmitted or spread to others.
meanings.sent1: The flu virus spreads communicably through coughing and sneezing.
meanings.sent2: She smiled communicably at her friend, sharing her joy.
meanings.sent3: The gossip traveled communicably around the school, causing excitement.
meanings.sent4: Laughter is communicably contagious, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The happiness in the room was communicably infectious, lifting everyone's spirits.

meanings.definition: Capable of being communicated or shared with others.
meanings.sent1: The important message was communicably clear to all the students.
meanings.sent2: He had a communicably friendly personality that made everyone feel welcome.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a pizza party was communicably appealing to the team.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm was communicably magnetic, drawing others in.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the air was communicably palpable, creating a buzz among the crowd.
